Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Palette for cosmetics
Description: Palette for cosmetics in the shape of a truncated diamond. Hewn from an opaque quartz, the colour of which varies from beige to dark red, its lengthwise cross-section is slightly curved. This type of artefact was used to grind green (malachite) or black (galena) cosmetics, traces of which are often found on such objects, but it is not the case here.
